content: Write a riddle in the style of Edgar Allan Poe.

In the still of the night, when the moon is full and bright,
A shadowy figure lurks, in the pale moonlight.
With eyes that burn like embers, in a face so white,
It whispers secrets old, in the dead of night.

Beneath the ancient willow, where the roots entwine,
A cryptic message lies, in letters that align.
Four words etched in stone, by a hand unknown,
Guide the seeker true, to a treasure overthrown.

But beware the traveler, who treads this path so thin,
For shadows hold secrets, that can drive you mad within.
The first word speaks of time, in cycles ever turning,
The second of a heart, that once loved and yearning.

The third is of a key, that opens doors unseen,
And the fourth, a name, that was once held in esteem.
Combine them well, and the way shall be clear,
To a prize long forgotten, beyond compare and peer.

Yet, should you falter, and the words misplace,
The shadows will claim you, in their cold, dark embrace.
So ponder well, and let your mind take flight,
In the realm of Poe, where darkness reigns bright.
